text.p: Let [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] be a [mathjaxinline]4\times 3[/mathjaxinline] matrix. Suppose that [mathjaxinline]x = \left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ 2 \\ 3 \end{array} \right][/mathjaxinline] is a solution to the equation [mathjaxinline]Ax = v[/mathjaxinline], and suppose that [mathjaxinline]x = \left[\begin{array}{c} 2 \\ -1 \\ 4 \end{array} \right][/mathjaxinline] is a solution to the equation [mathjaxinline]Ax = w[/mathjaxinline].
Find a solution to the equation [mathjaxinline]Ax = v+w[/mathjaxinline].
To enter a vector such as [mathjaxinline]\left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ 2 \\ 3 \end{array} \right][/mathjaxinline], you can either:

li.p: enter it as you would a [mathjaxinline]3\times 1[/mathjaxinline] matrix: [[1],[2],[3]]
or, you can enter it as <1,2,3>

font.p:
We are given:
[mathjaxinline]A \left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ 2 \\ 3 \end{array} \right] = v[/mathjaxinline]
[mathjaxinline]A \left[\begin{array}{c} 2 \\ -1 \\ 4 \end{array} \right] = w[/mathjaxinline]
Adding these equations, we get
[mathjaxinline]A t \left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ 2 \\ 3 \end{array} \right] + A \left[\begin{array}{c} 2 \\ -1 \\ 4 \end{array} \right] = v + w[/mathjaxinline]
[mathjaxinline]A \Bigg( \left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ 2 \\ 3 \end{array} \right] + \left[\begin{array}{c} 2 \\ -1 \\ 4 \end{array} \right] \Bigg) = v + w[/mathjaxinline]
[mathjaxinline]A \left[\begin{array}{c} 3 \\ 1 \\ 7 \end{array} \right] = v + w[/mathjaxinline]
